Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UlTmTJRFrKWxMQBM0luKUw.text: I am a repeated customer because I was very impressed with my first dinner there years ago. This time, unfortunately, it was a BIG disappointment. I had the 6 course dinner last time so this time, I tried the full tasting menu. The first appetizer caviar with crab was to die for, the other 3 cold appetizers came as a trio on the same setting and that was still very nice but then it started downhill from there. This is supposedly to be a fine dining restaurant, meaning one should be able to take the time to enjoy each course without feeling being rushed. However, I can see the next course already was sitting on a table nearby and our waiters can wait for us to finish so they can serve the next dish. What bothered me more is they would serve 3 hot entree on a trio so by the time I finished the first one, the second and third one is cold already. Also, a well planned menu should go from light to heavy taste. With the trio serving, no one cares to tell us which one to start with first so if you happen to choose a heavy tasting one first, the others would be very blend. When a guy in a suite called Bernard came by to ask how we enjoyed our meal, I didn't hesitate to tell him how I felt we were being rushed and how it is totally a waste of the food by serving them all at the same time. He said Chef Robuchon was there in March and he decided to change how the tasting menu should be served. His comments were UNBELIVABLY ridiculous " Well, what can I say, you can't argue with the chef. Maybe you can eat faster !!"" Excuse me, I didn't feel $500 ( before tips and wine ) so I can eat faster and having food served in a bento box. Given he may not agree with his boss BUT please give me a better response than asking me to eat faster. On the other hand, our server, David was just WONDERFUL, I believe he cared enough to listen and share my comments with Chef Clud so the next courses came out in a more reasonable pace and the chef himself did apologize and offered us the cheese plate and extra dessert. On the positive side, the dessert was way better than our previous meal and David did tell me they have a change of pastry chef.   So overall, Bernard's comments, the way they served their meal is NO WHERE close to what a Michelin 3 star restaurant should be. I have eaten at many Michelin star restaurants before and unfortunately this is the worst so far

zEZQyMGG7H_pw1_41Kc7mA.text: Dining here was definitely a magical experience.  From the attentive service staff, to the beautifully plated food, and the rolling carts, Joel Robouchon surpassed my expectations.  I dined here to celebrate my birthday and the chef even surprised me with a vacherin cake along side a beautifully crafted sugar sculpture. Yes this place is pricey...be ready to drop a grand easily on a meal for 2-3 people, but it is so worth it.  The menu changes 4 times a year to reflect the season so I will be back when spring comes around to taste his new creations.

trq8XzSI3zJMom9lxzVdBg.text: As an amateur food snob, we love to indulge in great food and amazing service. Reading that a majority of the reviews on YELP and elsewhere online were 5-stars, we decided on JR while we were in Vegas.   Call to reserve  the complimentary limousine service- totally worth it and you get to experience the MGM Mansion entrance. Restaurant service was severely lacking. We waited for 15 minutes just for the wine/cocktail menu although we were the only table in the restaurant with one other party of 8 in a side room. Additionally, we had to ask for beverages and water refills.  When we asked the waiter to bring specific cocktails at the time of entree service, they arrived two courses early with the excuse that the dining room director instructed her to bring them early, which was awkward.   Menu explanations were thorough as were the food descriptions at the time of service. The only True disappointment was the food. It just wasn't WOW worthy (typical of most French food). Plating was not creative nor inspirational.  The added caviar course was delicious, but how can you go wrong with caviar at $350/ounce??  All in all, we do not think the universal experience was worth the $1,036 final bill (including 20% gratuity).   L2O in Lincoln Park, Chicago still reigns supreme in all dining experiences (at 1/2 the cost of JR). Check out our review for L2O and make sure you visit if you're ever in Chicago!!

FvQtny1_QqMk6eVJm6f2qw.text: O man, where do I begin this experience? I called about a week ahead and it was really easy to get a table for a party of 4. They picked us up at our hotel with a limo and took us to the private entrance of the MGM mansion, which I guess only invited guests are allowed? Took a quick tour of the place and went to the restaurant.   After we ordered our food, they brought out the bread cart and it was AMAZING! At least 10 selections of awesome breads with butter hand churned from England or something. Just amazing.   Our dishes themselves were unbelievable, everything was just soo delicious. And we didn't need to order dessert at all, their dessert cart was amazing as well. Overall, we were full on a 3-4 course meal!

LkVv_hG0XyAYEEer7_-RTQ.text: Presentation was immaculate. It was truly a magical experience that will not be forgotten. The dining room was breathtaking, the food was incredible. So so worth your penny and time.

pIcSUl-eyck8T1U5f7TVDQ.text: An impeccable restaurant. With reservations a complimentary limo is sent to pick you up. You are then escorted through the MGM Mansion entrance to the restaurant. Thereby bypassing the annoying sounds and confused people on the casino floor. It is about a 10 minute walk ladies with heels. Graciously seated they know you are coming and direct you right to your table. There are a few different tasting menus available of two, four, six, and 16 at 135, 168, 215 and 385 respectively. An amuse-bouche, bread, petit fours and coffee or tea accompanies all meals. It is prudent now to discuss the bread. Served on a cart trolley there are about 2 dozen lovely varies of bread to choose from. General you take three different kinds in the beginning. Once chosen your bread is taken in the back to be warmed and whisked back to you in a moment. The butter is shaved off a block and while lovely it is cold. I dislike cold butter for bread.  The menu doesn't change too much from week to week. Changes are mainly substations based on availability. The food is excellent. There wasn't a dish I didn't care for. From plating to palette, from texture to temperature the food was excellent. Portions were a touch too large for me but I prefer smaller portions in general.  The meal closes with a petit fours trolley of four dozen or so sweets to tempt you as you swirl down the last of your wine. More decadent then the bread trolley and all the more enticing. It is an exhausting delicious list.  I nearly forgot about the booze. Yes there are the perfunctory wine pairings. They also have several available by glass, half bottle and bottle. The cocktails are available but not very good. As a cocktail dork I would suggest sticking with wine here.  Service is generous and kind. All requests are taken with earnest and if at all possible fulfilled.  Is it worth it? Absolutely. I certainly look forward to having another meal here.

n6imD7cqO8K8RwdJpLihmg.text: Dinner here was as much a visual treat as a gustatory treat. Everything was extremely tasty and beautiful!  There are several tasting menus to choose from. They also have a bread cart and dessert cart, and they send u home with chocolates!  It is pricey, however. Dinner for 2 was about $500, and we didn't go crazy.

9RHx607JzTJojcuiIpzPwg.text: Fantastic food, intimate size and unbelievable attention to every detail. If you are looking for the finest food in Las Vegas (albeit pricey) you cannot go wrong with Robuchon. The restaurant is located right next door to the showroom for Ka.

hUa0u89YgR7mV6HCgpiTUg.text: This by far the best meal I have ever eaten.  Gustatory perfection. 16 course tasting menu, each course unbelievable. The chef demonstrates a mastery of cooking which is truly awe inspiring. Head and shoulders above many other Michelin starred restaurants. Service 5 star. Food 5 star. Ambiance 5 star. Perhaps this restaurant may be equalled, but it cannot be topped.

704Sy0PtGpWsnvAZEwksgw.text: Went here with my wife on her 30th birthday.  Everything is perfect, from the food to service to the wine selection.   We both have a six course meals, every single course you experience a different wow factor.  My wife and I don't drink a lot but with the wine they recommend we able to finish a bottle and a half.  My wife never finish her meal this restaurant is the only place that she ate everything.  It' s not good for my pocket...  :(

89ag6xC718VOFHuToupgVQ.text: This was probably the best meal of my life!  I had the 16 course menu back in January 2008, and it was phenomenal.  Probably the most expensive meal of my life, but you only live once, right?  The Robuchon style is very elegant and sophisticated yet fun and whimsical at the same time.  Where else can you find strange little baubles and ribbon on your table and plate?  Presentation seems wacky if you pick pieces apart, but put it all together, and it works.    I ate during truffle season!  This is the way to go-- wait for the truffle menu to come around.  The truffle tart was outrageous.  The bread cart and dessert trolley make the meal beyond great.  Where else does this happen?  (A side note: I ate at the French Laundry less than a month before Robuchon, and Robuchon blew FL out of the water.  At Robuchon I had 16 courses plus a bread trolley, sorbet and petit four trolley in 3 hours; at the Laundry we had 14 courses in 5 hours.  The French Laundry was seriously lagging and everything was sooo rich, we were full halfway through.  Unlike the French Laundry, the flow of service and amount of food at Robuchon were perfect.)  Robuchon is a fantastic place to eat.  It's not just a restaurant, it's an experience.

uqx6ZpehLOgV5TmMKgYNgw.text: For the Price and for the name of Joel Robuchon .. if you never try other branch ..  The best one should be the one in Tokyo Ebisu . The delicate setting of food is double then Vegas yet the price is cheaper . Service is better too . so that one will be my 5 stars or 6 stars .   Joel Robuchon is a great chef . The best I ever had . but this Vegas store has disappoint me a lot .

gzjX0she2ehwe47OSdyKzg.text: Wow.  Best 5 hour dinner of my life.  From the bread cart to the dessert cart, I was in gastronomical heaven.  Go full out and do the supremo tasting menu, none of the ala cart BS.

ACunnwAMxMkEN7peSH1vog.text: Foie Gras. Alba White Truffles. Alsatian Riesling. [takes bite] "Are you kidding me?"  [looks at fellow diners, bewildered] "good lord." [sniffs robust slices of white truffles] "this isn't happening." [sniffs again] "ok, maybe it is."  no joke, this is how every course of the degustation menu went down. I also got really sauced without intending to. It was the champagne, I tell you!  if you're going to do it up big time here, please make sure you only have one drink before you come in. Don't do what I did and, ahem, overdo it.  Alas, the meal was a revelation. This is something few will experience in their lives. Incredible. I had to almost be forklifted out. I would detail everything I had, but it's not necessary. Be surprised when you go. Be enchanted.   Harley, the wine director, was a class act, even when I accidentally called him Harvey.   The only beef I had was with the decor. Think "mid-90s Disney movie set in Renaissance-era France," and don't be surprised if the chairs and candelabras start dancing and serving you food. Or maybe that was just the fact that I was past the point of no liver return.

GLW8vYwjfrDJf-kLdDS57A.text: I've been all over the world and ate at the best places... this is one of them! Do yourself a favor, go during the winter and get the White Truffle tasting menu. It will cost about $500/pp but it is worth it.

XL12evBo4ueCeIAyyEe5yA.text: I saw pictures of my friends dining here and was drawn to the very exquisite dining room.  So we decided to treat ourselves to dinner here during our spring break trip to las vegas. Upon reading the reviews and tips on Yelp (and very happy we did), we called ahead and had a limo picked us up from Bellagio where we were staying. It was fun riding in a limo with the license plate MGM2 (we later found MGM1 and took a picture with it).  Just a couple of turns from the usual streets, the limo drove us through the huge gate into this beautiful courtyard. We were led through the private VIP service desks, fountains, gardens, and eventually through another gate back to the regular MGM lobby. That was an experience in itself.  The dining room was lavishly decorated with purple and white chairs and chandeliers.  The service was really good.  We had a Cantonese server that spoke our language who guided us through all the food and gave us tips for choosing the bread, the cheese and the desserts.  He even gave us free fruits to go with the cheese. The reason that I gave it a 4 stars is because while I remember the experience perfectly well.  None of the food really stood out.  While everything we had was great, there was none that was heavenly.  Nevertheless, it's a restaurant that worth a trip to try!

3bXLkoZa2OOtzLE7zVbvGA.text: Good Food cozy room but not what you would expect from such a high rated experience. Communication between the staff regarding bar drinks and wine was intolerably slow almost 25 minutes and the wine was great but the service aspect was amateur with this part of the evening. The food was wonderful very well described very heavy an after the 16th course I felt gluttonous but very well worth the eating experience at least once. We dined on a Saturday night at 9pm

V_1uNI39e6pZrNd4dWC8rg.text: i was thoroughly impressed after sampling 16 course degustation tasting menu at JR, every dish is exquisite and unique,as if JR has orchestrated a series of surprises awaits to impress his patrons. the desserts and les mignardises propel this opulently decadent dining experience into a state of ecstasy, i always feel that the desserts in "most" of the U.S restaurants are the weakest link, JR has stay True and exemplify the french pastry tradition by presenting its desserts with both visually stunning as well as flavorful to leave an indelible ending for this stellar dining experience,  the elegantly decorated interior of the restaurant adds a dose of parisian element to the surrounding  this is definitely the most unforgettable fine dining experience i had so far, chef joel robuchon truly deserves his 3 michelin stars and i hope i will return to experience this sumptuous culinary journey while stopping by vegas in the future

RdKtNbs2S_fVYrt0ix5BNQ.text: I agree with every positive review here. Only 1 - 2 dishes (thankfully they were appetizers and not the savory dishes) that were okay to good. The remaining 14 - 15 dishes were fantastic. Excellent bread cart, great desserts, great service, etc. Extremely full at the end of the meal. Don't listen to people who say there isn't enough food. My guess is that they overeat and expect a buffet. This is fine dining.

mBvG0cQTUw_H7gGKFzR6Aw.text: The facts: My finest meal...  ever.  My personality: I'm Chinese, being cheap is in my genes.  Joel Robuchon at the Mansion was an eye-opening experience.  Never in my wildest dreams did I believe that paying $360 per person would ever be worth it (this is the standard price for the degustation menu), but eating here changed my mind (to tell the truth, you really don't have much of a choice at Robuchon.  Penny-pinchers can opt for the "cheaper" $225 per person menu, but that's about all you have in terms of choice).  Wifey and I walked in breathing fire.  We told each other that no place on god's green earth could ever be worth the money we were about to flush here.  All we wanted was the experience and a nice story to tell about how we were once young and crazy and blew a chunk o' money at Vegas.  Well, the cheap Chinese part of my persona now hates me.  I am very close to saying that Robuchon may actually be worth it.  Joel Robuchon is probably one of the world's greatest living chefs.  He has more Michelin stars than he knows what to do with, and has been one of the biggest influences in the post-Nouvelle cuisine era.  The man was a living god even before he appeared on Japan's Iron Chef!  Now don't mistake this place for L'atelier Joel Robuchon which is the more casual-themed restaurant nestled right next door at MGM... this place is the Mount Everest of fine dining. So why should you consider dropping a grand on one meal? Well lemme tells ya... Everything here is "over the top".  From the selection of 28 kinds of bread from the bread cart, to the impressively gaudy 30ft ceilings and purple themed dining room, and the requisite snooty French waiter.   Every plate was a work of art and the creativity was impressive.  What softened the pain I felt when I signed the outrageous credit card bill was the fact that they did everything possible to make this worth your hard-earned money.  They shaved truffle onto everything, stuffed foie gras into every nook and cranny, and topped whatever they could with caviar.  In fact, I almost believe that they would sprinkle truffles over the guests if they thought it would make your experience better.  I would recommend this place highly!!  ***** UPDATE  11/07***** No, I didn't go back (yet)...  But I feel VINDICATED now that the world-famous Michelin Guide has reviewed Las Vegas and has determined that the ONLY establishment worthy of three stars is.... Joel Robuchon at the Mansion! As of this writing, the Michelin Guide has only reviewed 4 cities in the US: New York, San Francisco, Los Angeles, and Las Vegas.  Only 6 restaurants amongst all of these cities were awarded 3-stars.  Los Angeles was the only city unable to produce a 3-star winner (confirming my suspicion that El Lay is a terrible food city).

2sV5GN9lAQJ4l_mg0ed3Yg.text: In the City of Sin, this place is HEAVEN!  If you know that there's no way of you entering through the pearly gates of afterlife or if you'd just like to experience it now, you MUST go to Joel Robuchon at the Mansion.  True, the price tag is steep.  But, can you really put a price on the culinary apex.  (I use the word apex because it's all downhill from here.)  From one dish to the next Chef Le Tohic just challenges your imagination and palette.  On June 1, 2008, his 16 course tasting menu took us on a mariner's voyage.  On a final note, sixteen courses were tough.  Everything was a dream, it was all so good that I forgot to pace myself.  It nearly put me in a (food) coma, and that's when boyfriend started singing... girlfriend in a coma, i know, i know, it's serious.  (silly)  Thank you Chef Le Tohic and your staff, especially Jan, our amazing table attendant.  You made my birthday a very memorable experience.  ================================== Our menu is as follows:  (Amanda B. took great pictures of the meal that night, see Photos)  0. Bread  - You have to see this.  It's a well presented bread tray, baked fresh daily with nearly twenty varieties.  And, they have them reheated after you choose so they arrive warm. 1. L'AspergeBlanche - White Asparagus "Panna Cotta", fresh almonds and lemon grass.  - This was simple, refreshing, and well presented dish. 2. La Tomate - Salad of tomato, olive oil with basil, tomato gelee topped with mozzarella cheese.  - This dish came in two parts, but meant to be consumed together.  The gelee looked like a plate of miniature eyes.  And, the staff shuck the gelee after they sit it down that it made me giggle seeing all those moving eyes looking at me.  But, back to the dish itself.  Wow!  The tomato was such a delight and the gelee made it a really fun dish. 3, 4, 5. Le Caviar - thin couscous and Oscetra caviar, smooth cauliflower cream, delicate gelle of green asparagus.  - This trio of caviar from Iran was heaven on earth. 6. L'CEuf - Egg yolk in a baby spinach ravioli with morels.  - When we cracked into to this ravioli, the quail yolk just oozed goodness. 7. La Saint-Jacques - Scallops royal with chive emulsion and buckwheat tuile.  - The tuile made this dish very playful. 8. Les Crustaces - Truffle langoustine raviloli with chopped cabbage, sea urchin, potato puree with hint of coffee and ginger perfumed tea.  - Jan highly recommended the langoustine in this trio.  According to him, it is the best dish he's ever had.  And, I have to say, the langoustine is pretty high up on my list too. 9. Les Petits Pois - Light pea veloute with mint on top of delicate sweet onion custard.  - Good dish, but, at this point, I began to slow down.  Lucky for me, my boyfriend loves a good pea veloute. 10. Le Thon - smoked and seared tuna, cauliflower, nori and green curry.  - Yummy yellowtail. 11. Le Veau - Sautee veal chop with natural jus and vegetable tagliernis flavored with pesto.  - The rosemary on the dish was very powerful to the nose.  But, set that aside, the veal was perfect. 12. Les Pousses de Soja - Soy beans cooked risotto style with lemon zests and coriander.  - The soy bean was presented to me in a way that I never had it before, and it was good. 13. L'Acai - Red fruits franite, fresh raspberry and yogurt sorbet.   - This dish really woke me up.  Very refreshing, very good. 14. Le Caramel - Caramel cremeux infused with Arabica, chocolate rice soufle.   - Oh, men!  Think of a multi-layered dessert where you have to take your spoon and dip it through all the layers, then in one quick swoop, pull it up and take the perfect bite of chocolate goodness.  As a chocoholic, it was very nice! 15. Raspberry Ice Cream Cake  - A full raspberry ice cream cake (that could serve 8 people and there were only two at the table) arrived at our table with a candle and everyone wished me a happy birthday, a very sweet touch.  We had this with our favorite teas, I blache and my boyfriend oolong. 16 - Le Cafe ou le The - escorte de mignardishes - special tasting of varieties sweet desserts.  - I could barely take a bite of the cake, let alone the sweets.  We had a great and the staff was amazing.  Thus, we entrusted Jan to put together a couple boxes of goodies, which was accompanied by two copies of the menu and another full 8" tall, 8" round fruit cake.

y5R5w1neajj_-3w-IXbxkw.text: This was my third visit, and my most expensive dinner of the trip.  While I enjoyed dinner at Robuchon, I wasn't as "blown away" as I was last year.  I had the 6 course dinner and two of the courses had $60 supplementary charges.  Still adore the bread cart (no restaurant has a better one).  Service was excellent.  Three of my six courses underwhelmed me.  The lobster, uni and fried rice that I swooned over last year had lobster that was somewhat overdone (dry); it was very flavorful though.  The beef that was supposed to be similar to wagyu, although served med-rare was not able to be cut with the butter knife provided.  After too many efforts, I finally asked for a steak knife which didn't help too much since there was too much gristle in the beef.  Shame since what pieces of beef that I could eat had nice flavor.  The pommes puree were their usual perfection!  Loved the egg and caviar in the potato nest.  The veal broth with veal ravioli, champignons and black truffle was very nice.  The cheese course didn't have enough soft cow's milk cheeses (they had plenty last year though).  The dessert was excellent:  meringue sphere with apple sorbet and apple cubes.  While not as magnificent as the Sphere du Sucre from last year, it was lovely.  The bon-bon trolley always delights (although I was getting full).  Love having the gold limo pick me up at the hotel and return me back to the hotel.

kyL82i3V1cBxGQHPbwvuqA.text: Truly an once in a lifetime experience.  I had the 16 course meal & hubby had the 3 course...good combination & just the right amout of food for the 2 of us...the gruyere bread is out of the world good....it literally needs 3+ hours to enjoy the food....

K1H2aSpuLwzIHeEA79y9rg.text: Me and my wife's first 3 Michelin star restaurant. Bottom line is we've been to 1 Michelin star places with much better food. The decor and preso was all very nice but nothing about the food was innovative.  I had veal cheeks drenched in what was essentially Tom Yum soup and scallops in Thai coconut curry.  The food is not bad by any means... just not worth the $$$$.   One positive note was the dessert was very good. Overall, very overpriced for what you get.

K1D7Wkp0ncFujBzuJn-2oA.text: i'm probably in the minority here, but i just don't get it...maybe my palate just isn't used to "haute cuisine."  yes, you're completely waited on hand and foot, the food is good and inventive...but i just can't justify a $900 + meal that wasn't mind blowing.  i would have rather spent $900 at bartolotta, where every bite i take makes me want to kiss the chef...or could have bought 2 pairs of jimmy choo or manolo's.

DeZtcg9aLP7gfeCoxTYSiQ.text: Fantastic food. Out of this world. Friendly people, great service. Lovely tasting menu. he decor was stunning, given its location. The atmosphere was nice and relaxing, perfect to enjoy a wonderful meal.

mk0DHzJPsltZbLB_GuDDyQ.text: Legendary dinner from a legendary chef. Not only is Joel Robuchon the person with the most amount of Michelin Stars (28 to be exact) but that translates to the plates here at the restaurant with his own name on the door. We wanted some good French food while we were in town and this was the highest rated place. Long story short we didn't know what we were getting ourselves into. Heads up it is very expensive, and thats coming from me. But thats what you should expect from a 3 Michelin Star restaurant (Michelin stopped judging Vegas in 2009) but the whole experience was phenomenal from start to end. We ended up choose the option on the menu which was a little less expensive on the menu compared to the tasting menu which was over $400 per person. We got 1 appetizer 1 Entree and some dessert. I went with the Seared Scallops which came with green curry with young leeks for my App and for entree I went with the Ribeye and they bring a dessert Trolly around along with a bread trolly before the main courses. They bake more than 12 different types of bread that were each the best bread I have had, they just melt in your mouth. I also got an Ice Wine from Canada which was very sweet and delicious. Overall I would come back but it would need to be celebrating something to be able to drop that much for one dinner. It's not just food though its an experience and an orchestra.

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Us95bEzsUqqoEvfV70vwnA.text: There aren't many details that others haven't said already but wanted to chime in that this was probably the best meal me and my wife have ever had. Although quite expensive and not for everyone, the 16 course meal was heavenly. I went with the standard option and my wife with the vegetarian, both meals with some overlapping items were delicious and beautifully presented. Service was impeccable.  Some side points include making sure you leave yourself 3-4 hours for the meal. Opting to get some tea with infused herbs was a good choice. The only critique would be that the bread cart did not live up to my expectations but maybe I chose the wrong ones to sample (it seemed that Guy Savoy's was better).

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio of foie gras and potatoes covered with parmesan and black truffle shavings.
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Herb cart for infusion teas.

rLpBI9og7iMPAUsKVHoXTg.text: Wow. My only regret is that our reservation was so late that by the end I was too tired (and full) to sample anything from the dessert cart.  This restaurant is super super spendy but if you can splurge it is totally worth every penny. The dishes are unique but not so out there that it's hard for a picky eater to enjoy.  Honestly can't remember all the dishes so I posted our menu. I loved the caviar starter - it was one of my favorites of the night. L'avocat and la daikon were also standouts. I thought the wagyu was ok - I've had better Japanese wagyu at other places. The soft boiled egg dish was a waste of space in my belly - wish it had come at the end so I could have just skipped it. Also could have done without l'aubergine- not a fan of the curry flavor.  My only complaint is that I felt the service lacking a bit for a Michelin star restaurant. Maybe it was just our server but he was very impersonal. Not to the extent of being rude but I definitely prefer more friendly service. We thought we would be hungry after the tasting menu but all the dishes that come out become really filling when there are so many.  So glad I got to experience this restaurant! Highly recommend for a special occasion.

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Started off the dinner strong. Caviar was sooooo good.
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Uncomfortably full after eating all this!!

QxVWRTE7hLu8gs9mxBrHdg.text: Decided to come here for dinner before our show. We only had 1.5 hours so they recommended the 2 course meal. This review is only for the 2 course meal. It was just ok. I had the squid ink paata as my main course. It was a little intimidating since we were the only patrons there. Felt like we were in the library. Service is fine. I liked how they had so many bread choices. However i wished the second time I picked out my bread they would have warmed it up like the first time. Drinks here are very generic unless you like Hennessey, then there are more options. I wish I had more time because I really wanted to try their hen dish. Also got a pound cake for the next day. I ate it 2 days later and it was still moist, but a little too sweet for my taste. Overall, for the 2 course meal, it was just ok. I'd recommend going for the bigger tasting menu option.

hUOMf6qoTqLyTJnej7PYbg.text: This restaurant is elegant, the food is not that good for the price you pay. I had a tomato soup which was too sweet and the bread on the table was a cold and unfresh. The entree was very good I had the beef and the dessert was also very good, but a friend had a stomach ache and diarrhea.

U8Lf46DSx3_i7k3XSOdbCA.text: one of the best meals of my life: the entire experience was beautiful. truly special occasion dining -- service & food is unparalleled. if u can afford it, go. better yet, get someone else to pay ;)

ESxBSSSom6Sj1lUX0wTgAw.text: Extremely upset! This is not what we would have expected at such a hi end restaurant. A large part of our vacations revolve around our dining experiences. With that said we were looking forward to dining here and unfortunately there was a mixup with the times, at the end we were late, 15-20 minutes to be exact. They informed us they had to release our spot and the would try to seat us, in the meantime they offered us to go to their main restaurant next door to sit in their lounge, no music no atmosphere other than being in detention at the library. When the bartender comes over with what looks like a novel he has no personality, after examining this giant book of wines there's nothing under $50 for a glass, even their house wine. We order a glass and he just dumps it in the glass, no explanation of what it is or flavors or notes to expect. This is $50 a GLASS! So for that we made up our mind that this is a snooty stuck up place that's not worth the 4-$500 it most likely would have cost to have a meal there. So we left! 49 minutes later we receive a phone call from the restaurant wondering if we still wanted our seats! Really? Where was this phone call the first time? So if your into spending way over normal upscale prices and like to hang with the snobs your in luck with this place, otherwise go anywhere else and be treated better

vTzjg_OQMcZToFkFs47r1Q.text: The desserts are simply amazing! Great amount of selections~ And love the luxurious Art Deco

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tasting menu
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;black forest&#34; dessert

SxZVZzpooVBoVMb9QtL4xw.text: I dined at Joel Robuchon 3-4 times within 2014 - 2015 because it was just that good... I would plan my trips to Vegas around my Joel Robuchon (and Guy Savoy) reservation times. Call me crazy, but this restaurant is literally worth planning all my important life events around.  Anyways, there is such a huge selection of food on the menu, which constantly changes. Every time I dine at JR, I was able to try different dishes. On my first visit, I opted for the "Degustation Menu," which was basically a huge comprehensive Chef tasting menu. Everything was intricate and delicious. I especially appreciated the crab jelly topped with a thick layer of Ossetra caviar. On my next visits, I chose the 5-course menu, customized to serve any 5 dishes of my choosing (again, hugeeeeeee selection on the ever-changing menu). Another of my favorites was the black truffle langoustine ravioli topped with foie gras reduction (this is orgasm on a plate in the culinary world).  While every single course entertained my palate, the highlight of my meal in all my visits were the beginning and the happy ending - BREAD CART AND DESSERT CART (yes, caps are necessary). There were probably 20+ different types of breads choose from, and of course I chose to try 'em all. All pieces were fresh, warm, and oh so delicate.... best carbs I've ever put in my mouth. And the desserts? Another 50+ pastries, candies, cakes, cookies, macarons, etc to choose from. Again, I insisted on having them all and it was the best decision I've ever made in my life!!!! SO PERFECT.  In short, it is safe to say that Joel Robuchon is by far one of my favorite restaurants in the world and I would come back over and over again...

-F0XB8R0SNsCTYfKtVIgHQ.text: My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here on a Sunday night, and while we didn't order the full 17 course degustation menu, we were still treated like royalty.  Specifically, I ordered the amuse boche, 1 appetizer (Langoustine ravioli), entree (pork), and the sweets while my wife ordered the amuse boche, entree (seabass), and dessert.  The ravioli was sensational along with the pork.  As others have noted, both the bread cart and sweet cart is overwhelming.  What's incredible is that the head waiter has all 40+ items memorized.  The table service was outstanding, and we would definitely return.

lfvZyAtcc6BUcvuQwBXP1A.text: Incredible birthday celebration! They took excellent care of us and made it a memorable birthday!

jp5oCom5y-WRYj1CdSJ4cg.text: Absolutely fantastic! Fabulous service! This was my first Michelin 3-star dining experience, and it was a very memorable in how creative everything was.   16 courses tasting menu! Every dish was a surprise!! My most favorite dishes would be the foie gras appetizer and the scallop. And desserts were wonderful!! Great experience in 2015 :)

l3ltgXmLOX1LugoXZhifBQ.text: Joel Robuchon is the chef w/ the world's most Michelin stars. This restaurant is a '09 Michelin 3 star, the last year the Michelin guide came out for Las Vegas.   Reservation took 60 days. They ask where you'll be staying during your reservation process. Word on the street is that there is a complimentary limo available for pick-up for non-MGM staying patrons.  They'll also ask if you'll be celebrating any event as they'll prepare a special cake for the occasion along with a morning after bun?!?  The precision of this restaurant is world class, from service, food, to presentation.  The 16-course tasting menu is a 3+ hour endeavor that is $435/person before tax, gratuity, and beverages.  Some memorable hits: - The Bread Cart! - The Dessert Cart! - Foie Gras - Lobster - Scallop - Caviar  The meal ended with a take-away goody bag with a book, the menu of the evening, along with marshmallows to enjoy later!  ...definitely a once-in-a-lifetime experience! :D

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Bar
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Boeuf
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Broccolini

mHo55V_QEfNGMGv5cuNvyQ.text: Joel Robuchon perfectly embodies the essence of the ultra-ostentatious city of Las Vegas in all its sinfully delicious glory. The extravagant decor will leave you breathless--as will the bill at the end of the meal.. but let's worry about that later, shall we?   We were guided by the hostess into a gorgeous "garden" with a moss wall and beautifully fragrant, vibrant flowers. From our seats, we could see the enormous chandelier in the central dining room. I highly recommend requesting this table because it was absolutely stunning! Pretty sure even the Italian Mafia seated next to us were impressed by the scenery.   We debated between 5-course Menu A ($250) or 16-course degustation ($445), but ultimately decided on Menu A with multiple supplements. Throughout the evening, the birthday boy and I played a game to compare whose dish was better. My choices slightly edged out his, but there's no surprise there. *insert princess emoji*.    For the sake of brevity, I'll just recommend the winning dishes:  Cold Appetizers:  L'Oursin- Sea Urchin with langoustine  Hot Appetizers: La Langoustine- Truffled Langoustine Ravioli with foie gras sauce (AMAZING! Suppl. $35)  Main Courses: Le Spaghetti- Spaghetti with a soft boiled egg, uni, caviar (best dish, hands down; Suppl. $60) La Langouste- Lobster with lemongrass emulsion  Desserts: La Sphere- Lemon shaped-sugar sphere filled with lemon sorbet La Chocolate- Black forest cake (CUTEST. DESSERT. EVER. Picturesque)  The bread cart is spectacular, but that dessert cart is simply DIVINE. Desserts so adorable that even the most apathetic sociopaths would squeal with joy.   Although the total bill came out to a whopping $825 with tax and tip, I'd say the entire experience was worth the hefty price tag.  It's unlikely I'd return because it was almost too rich to enjoy repeatedly, but for someone truly special (such as yourself, duh) there's no better way to celebrate. Nothing says "I love you" quite like foie gras, black truffle, and caviar. Except for.. ah, nevermind.   Best girlfriend award or what?

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. dessert cart. LOVE
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La chocolat
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. La sphere

rJbW15pXJ_ZQ0tBonOZmBQ.text: This is truly fine dining at its BEST!  Everything from the atmosphere, service, food presentation...and of course, the food its self.  I think when dining at a French restaurant, one really needs to appreciate the details put into the presentation.  Did the tasting menu and everything was just remarkable.  Might set you back $500/person, but if fine dining is your thing...then I would definitely say give it a try.  As always, my opinion is just that.  Please visit and decide for yourself!

fq55H4qM0fLmVyDUA7eKgw.text: 2 stars for one of the most famous chefs ever?  I know it sounds sacrilegious but hear me out.  While most of food was very good (except for the chocolate souffle, which was pretty awful), the experience overall was not what I would expect for the price.    My husband let them know it was my birthday when we made the reservation, and called them again a few days before to remind them, and they did literally nothing to acknowledge it.  I don't expect a free dessert, though that certainly would have been nice, but I frankly find it shocking at a restaurant of this price point that they could not even write "Happy Birthday" on the plate, stick a candle in the dessert I ordered, or wish me happy birthday in person.  Apparently they told my husband he could pay $30 for a mango cake for me (which he didn't do because I don't really like mango), and if he didn't do that, they would write a birthday message on whatever dessert I ordered.  It's bad enough they didn't do anything, but it's even worse that they told my husband they would and then didn't follow through.    I know you can't really think of fine dining in terms of value, but this is absurdly expensive by any definition.  The prix fixes are $127 or $169 for just 2 courses (depending on which two) and go up from there. The degustation is $445, way more than the French Laundry.  I don't think its unreasonable to have sky high expectations for these sky high prices.   The famous bread cart was good but not great.  All the bread was tasty but it all tasted pretty similar.  It's nice that they have small portions so you can try tons of kinds without filling up.  Contrary to what others have said, we weren't offered bread throughout the meal.  After the first visit, we asked for more bread once and they brought some, but they never wheeled the cart around again.  The amuse was probably my favorite part of the meal - a strawberry/tomato gazpacho with burrata and pistachios that was both creative and well-executed.  My husband did the appetizer/entree menu and his soft-boiled egg with mushrooms and asparagus appetizer was great.   For our entrees, I had veal that was very good and my husband had the beef, which he loved.  Both entrees came with the famous Robuchon whipped potatoes which look like mashed potatoes but have a very different texture.  They were excellent.    I did the entree/dessert menu, and I broke my "never pay supplements" rule and spent an extra $10 for the famous and supposedly fantastic "bitter chocolate souffle."  What a mistake.  It was neither fantastic nor bitter.  It was overly sweet and had almost no chocolate flavor.  It was huge though, so I asked to get it go and was told the chef "does not do that." What??? This is not a buffet.  I had already paid for it and the souffle is going in the trash if I don't eat it.  How unbelievably wasteful (and unhealthy - it encourages overeating).    The mignardise cart is beautiful and has at least 25 things on it, but they weren't great.  The macarons were extremely stale.  We weren't told there's a 5 item limit per person, like some reviews say, but we also didn't ask for one of everything.  We ordered about 6-7 pieces each.  We called to ask for the limo pickup and were told they have discontinued it for the month of May.  Admittedly, this isn't something the restaurant really advertises and I only knew about it from Yelp reviews but it was a big part of why we chose the restaurant and it was too bad that we couldn't have it.  Many restaurants put the bill in front of the man by default, but the sexist attitudes in their service went way beyond that.  They asked just my husband if we wanted wine and took away the wine list after he said HE didn't want wine.  And after I handed them my credit card with MY name on it to pay, the same guy then handed my husband the signature slip and a pen and said "Monsieur, s'il vous plait..."   It probably wouldn't have bothered me so much if the service during the rest of the meal had been better, but it was the proverbial straw that broke the camel's back.  My husband thinks 2 stars is too harsh because we had a pleasant meal and the food was great until the dessert course, but 3 stars on Yelp is "a-ok" and I'm sorry, we paid a ton and weren't satisfied, that's not a-ok.  (Also the dessert course was literally half my meal, so the fact that it sucked was a big factor).  Obviously a lot of Yelpers (and Michelin) disagree, though I do wonder if it's gone downhill recently, because many of the recent reviews seem lukewarm.  The dining room is absolutely beautiful, I'll give them that.

pwBJaiKeT0gAEL4x-hwwqA.text: For our 10th wedding anniversary we decided to go all out and dine at Joel Robuchon at the MGM Grand. Thanks to the yelp reviews, we knew to book their complimentary gold limo in advance and got one of the three pickup services of the evening. We were taken to the private gated entrance to the MGM mansion with $5000 a night villas (who knew?). Then led through the mansion and high stakes poker tables to the restaurant in the casino.  The meal: You do not have to order the degustation 16 course meal. Trust me on this. Not only do they offer an extensive bread cart with as much as you desire with honestly the best butter we have ever had (see pic) you do not have to order dessert as there is an included sweets cart with whatever you want.   I ordered the lobster ravioli for the appetizer and pork for my entree. Both hands down the best on the menu. The pork was so tender like cutting into a rib eye- the ravioli has been a staple on the menu since day one and you'll see why. My husband  ordered the chilled lobster, seared foie gras and sea bass along with the cheese cart for dessert since he's not a chocolate fan. One of the best meals of our lives and we've been to French Laundry in Yountville twice.   The service: this is where we only gave four out of five stars. The waiters were fantastic but again having seen the synchrony and service at French Laundry it's hard to compare.   Special note: the chef came out to chat a bit during dessert so that was a nice personal touch.   Would definitely return again.

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now that&#39;s what I&#39;m talking about! No need to order a separate dessert as this sweets cart is included.
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pork that is so tender - like a rib eye. Creamiest potatoes made with the same chunk of butter from precious picture...
Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster ravioli, their signature dish- a must.

bco-kLMo3iYQvs-IhuLfqw.text: Beautiful restaurant! Decorated in velvet purple, the color of royalty! This is where you will be treated like kings and queens! The trade off is that you be pick up a bill like the Queen of England. The cost, you will believe it, $700 for two.  But Joel Robuchon is one of my favs! The food is as expected for a 3 star Michelin restaurant! The ambience was a little stuck up but that's okay!

gJbVaV5Nm9UNrV7sR4IDdg.text: The chef and establishment have so many accolades and I was expecting something really amazing. I was really disappointed in the whole experience. I ordered the full course menu with my wife. 17 courses in all.   The things that stand out in my mind were the bread selection, the Kobe beef, a perfectly boiled egg, and some really good desserts.  For the price they should throw in a bottle of champagne and a little more spoilage. Out meal was $1500 without a wine pairing. We didn't even get to meet the chef. How do I know Joel was preparing the meals???? I can only hope for the amount I paid.  For that much money they should pamper the hell out of you. The vibe was cold and impersonal. In hindsight it wasn't worth it but at least I didn't loose that money on a roulette table.

photos.caption: Photo of Joël  Robuchon - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kobe beef .... The most memorable course during my dining experience

Ato6dJ_gipYFXLj3klLOZA.text: The service is amazing 10/10. Cane here for my 30th birthday.  The food... for the $500/person menu it wasn't impressive. First second and third dish wash just amazing.. impeccable; the next 4-5-6 was horribly rich.. just too much fat one after another... a mistake a chef should not do or whoever is choosing the menu.  The restaurant very small fells like Denny's, there is literally no room in between tables, feels like a fast food. I was expecting for a 3* Michelin restaurant to have an intimate atmosphere. I was unlucky to have a table across that was loud as a concert.  If is not incredibly busy they should really space out the tables.. not put them that close. They could've done that when i was there.  Over all if we talk only about food execution was 10/10 If we talk about how they choose the order of the food or the chef menu in general 4/10 Service 10/10 Ambiance 2/10  I'll put some pictures of some of the amazing food. Hi ven the bad food looked good :)  I spent more than 1400$ for two people, but I won't pat myself. It wasn't worth it.   Improve the seating area (we need way more space in between tables to feel comfortable and not feel like in a Denny's) , balance the chef menu better, ask people not to yell because they disturb other tables. We come here for a luxury experience and an amazing taste. I really didn't hit that note.. unfortunately... again the staff was amazing

qf1jYZcXFY8jeAV9dcY71A.text: Went here again on my most recent trip to Vegas. There are a lot of great places to eat in Vegas, but this is the best. Definitely make reservations.   There are so many great things we had here, but since I've already reviewed it, I'll stick with the highlights.   Bread cart- This thing is insane. They bring out a bread cart with 50 or so different types of bread and rolls. You pick what you want, they warm them up in the over for you, then bring them out. They also have this massive butter sculpture made out of the most baller butter on the planet. Not sure how to describe it, but I've never had butter that good. I could probably go for just the bread and dessert cart.  Langoustine Ravioli with Black Truffle- These were one of the best things I have eaten. Super, super rich, but absolutely decadent.   Dessert cart- like the bread cart above, but for dessert. Make sure you leave room. I think I tried everything and there was not one thing I didn't like.   We went there for my wife's birthday and they made a homemade ice cream cake for her. It was really nice of them and very tasty too. This plus the dessert cart ensured that I needed a wheelbarrow to get me out of there.   The service is probably the best I have experienced anywhere. Good luck getting your water below 3/4 full. There is an army of wait staff, but you never seem to notice them as they are very good about not being overbearing.   I will reiterate that this is the best restaurant in Vegas and probably one of the 5 best restaurants I've been to. There are lots of expensive places to eat, but this one tops them all. Compared to other pricey restaurants, I'd say there's pretty good value here.

i5Fx0x3E8nPI_VBfOD2SPA.text: I was in Vegas for a business trip and decided to splurge a little on a 3 course Michelin Star meal. I'm so glad I did! Service was great. Food was delicious. And my server even sneaked me a few extra dessert treats :) the $$$ was well worth it! Only thing that would have made it better is I got the opportunity to meet the chef (who apparently was serving a royal family who was dining in the private room). Ps you have to try the butter that goes with the bread...it was so thick and delicious. Will be back next time!

jg1ZG7BzRNa8vEiXNCXBgQ.text: Went there for my birthday dinner. We got there about 15 minutes before our reservation, and was shown into a bar area with comfortable seating to wait for our reserved time. We were seated in about 10 minutes at a nice corner booth ( only the two of us). I ordered their 4 course tasting menu ( 1 cold and 1 hot appetizer, 1 entree and 1 dessert). The waiter told us that it is a very popular selection. I have to agree with it because last time I went to a 3 star Michelin restaurant and ordered a 10 course tasting menu, I was so full halfway through it. I am very happy that they actually give you a choice  to that, which other 3 star restaurants do not.  They also have a great bread selection and let you pick from their bread cart, as well as a petit four selection cart to choose your sweets.  The food is excellent to say the least. I ordered the lobster with truffled sauce as my cold appetizer, truffled ravioli with foie gras as hot appetizer ,Iberia pork from Spain as my main entree and a chocolate mousse for desserts. To top it off, the waiter came with a whole birthday cake for my birthday! They also gave me a lemon cake to take home. I think this is given to all the ladies too. Very enjoyable experience! Although I must caution about the price of champagne if you were to order one. I had a glass of rose champagne and it caused $48 a glass. Still totally worth it for the experience!

gqjRlcCxJTHTORqUETOPnA.text: Amazing food, experience and service!  Everything about this restaurant is on point.  Food is obviously fantastic, the presentation is great, but what blew me away was the mixture of textures and flavor!  Service is great, and the ambiance is great!  We did the full tasting menu, and loved every dish on there!

6WP_rzjNVkLCbf-ICsOiew.text: Let me just say that I have been here before, and I have been to many 3 Michelin Star restaurants as well. Last time I was here there was an obnoxious group of people dining in flip flops and shorts sitting near us, the reason I am telling you all this is plays an important role in my review.  We came this time on a comp from a casino host who told us the dress code was business casual, we walked in and was clearly profiled by the hostess and told we were not allowed in because they require formal attire, when I mentioned the other clearly not formal group dining last time I was told "well sometimes we relax the dress policy on slow days"  This was clearly a case of being profiled by a person who should not work at a place like this, all the fine dining places I have been to have all revolved around the best service and finding solutions to issues not just turning up a nose and getting rid of people you think do not belong. Joel Robuchon is rolling over in his grave tonight.

FdB27nxFGZ1VWU38FJVKXw.text: When I first walked in I was a little bit intimidated... This place is intense! The hostess was very friendly and a few people even recognized him as he comes here a lot. This was my first time and he was taking me out for a treat. Everything in this place is so delicately placed. I loved the array of jewels on the table, it's a very nice touch. I ordered a very nice glass of cabernet and they also brought out a delicious amuse-bouche. Some kind of cute quinoa ball. It was actually really good, almost too cute to eat. The bread cart is out of this world. There were two kinds with cheese so of course I had to try those, plus my boss recommended the milk one.... That one practical melts in your mouth. I think our waiter knew it was my first time and that I barely got to eat any of the extremely fresh butter so he recommended that I try some crusty bread... And I tried to say no, but I'm so glad I accepted. It was so good.   Then they brought out some kind of caviar served on top of something with a cauliflower puree. Next they brought out my appetizer of truffled langoustine ravioli in a foie gras sauce with simmered green cabbage... And it was absolutely amazing. Highly recommend. I had never heard of langoustine before, but Abel said it was like a cross between lobster and  shrimp. He's right that was exactly how it tasted. It was so good.  The staff was incredibly effective and helpful to ensure that no allergy or intolerance was missed. They take great care in paying attention to detail. My main course was the ribeye and it was obviously very good but they brought out these mashed potatoes and oh my goodness... Best mashed potato puree EVER.  Then the dessert cart... It's scary because everything is so tiny and adorable that you don't realize how much you are eating! This is definitely one of the best meals that I've ever eaten.

The full tasting menu is too much... we ended up being very full at the last couple dishes. It definitely affected the experience.

BbMXIap8ap0JCu0Jt55BFA.text: Named chef of the century, every one of his flag ship restaurants in Michelin guide cities having three stars and his lesser L'Ateleir at least one.  Award after award and all well deserved.  I've covered the exquisite food in earlier reviews. I will use the majority of this review space to answer the most frequently asked questions I've received and those with no published answers.  First, the mandatory review update:  A meal here is an experience in dining pleasure.  Exquisite food, outstanding service, beautiful wine pairings, incredible dining space, everything comes together to create memories that will last a lifetime. Make no mistake, this is one of the best dining experiences in the world.    The food combines classic French techniques with molecular gastronomy. Ingredients are top notch and have a major impact on the finished product. The butter, hand churned, imported from France has a very unique, almost citrusy flavor to it.    Extremely smooth, rich, and creamy, but not oily or cloying.  Its flavor apparent in the signature mashed potatoes (50% potato, 50% butter).    A standout signature dish, a simple French hen (for two), it's beautiful poultry flavor enhanced by a lobe of foie roasted with it and served together.  The resulting jus heavenly.  Its mineral, livery notes bringing out sweetness and complexity in the moist hen.  The melting fat, richness.  Service is impeccable delivered by professionals who have made service and fine dining a career (ie running the dining room at the Tokyo location for years before coming to Vegas). Extremely personable and friendly if you allow them to be.  FAQs  - Are reservations required?  Yes.  Weekend and holiday reservations require a minimum two month advance reservation. This applies to platinum and noir Mlife members as well as guests of executive properties, Aria SkySuites and MGM SkyLofts. (Even my host couldn't alter my reservation to a later time). Email or phone confirmation required 24 hours in advance of your reservation.  - is there an ala carte menu? No. Select one of five menu options, Priced according to the number of starters and entrees (i.e., one starter, one entree $127; Choice of two starters, two entree, one dessert $250). The full degustation menu, 16 courses, is $495.  All menus include an amuse, anything from the bread cart, and anything from the petite fours cart.  They are supplemental charges for many of the dishes.  Simply add that to the price of your menu. Tax and service not included.  - are portions scaled based on the number of courses ordered? No except for the degustation menu.    - does every person at the table need to order the same number of courses?  Aside from the degustation menu, no but it is HIGHLY recommended.  You don't want to see someone sitting at your table not eating anything while you enjoy your course right?  - do they offer wine pairings? Yes and no. There are pairings for the degustation menu from $300-$1000.  For all other menus, custom by the glass or better yet by the bottle pairings can be created.  Use the som.  He is extremely well versed in their excellent cellar.  Very heavy emphasis on French wines, all properly cellared and ready to be drunk. The average bottle price is $550.  - do they pressure guest to order expensive wines? No. Be sure to let the som know what you want to spend.  Don't be afraid to admit you are not very familiar with a varietal, French wines, etc.  He does an incredible job sharing his passion and enthusiasm with you.  - what exactly is the dress code? Casual elegant. An evening dress is appropriate for the ladies, suits for men. At very least, jackets are required.  No denim, no athletic wear, no sneakers,  - How long will dinner be?  Allow at least 3 to 5 hours. My recent visit, two starters one entree and one dessert, 4.5 hours.  - What is the real price of dinner?  Dinner for three including two starters, one entree, one dessert each, two bottles of average priced wine, a round of vintage champagne by the glass and a couple of  pours of vintage  Madera, tax and gratuity; $2,800.  Definitely a celebratory indulgence but well worth it.

My highlight was the mashed potatoes oddly enough as I don't think I will ever eat better mashed potatoes! Great staff and so much detail in everything they do.

gGMECwZ7nele1L_LNSrJ0g.text: I am a huge fan of Joel Robuchon (RIP), it was such an honor to have eaten at one of his restaurants. The food and service were both AMAZING. You won't find a better restaurant in Las Vegas. There is a reason why he earned the coveted 3 Michelin Star Award for this restaurant. Going here was one of the best experiences of my life! If you want a night to remember... This is the place to go! If I ever go back to Las Vegas, I will definitely come back!  The presentation is like artwork. Everything is beautiful. Interesting and creative flavors. The staff is wonderful and helpful. Great wine. A True dining experience. variety and how well it was all prepared. Everything looked like art and tasted even better. Best bread you will ever eat too. Deserts are amazing and you get to choose as much as you like from the desert trolley.  I hope i can go back soon;)

pgQu-2X1v_tLrmD_9hv2ew.text: Guest post by Cathey using Rob's account ;)  Overall 4.5 but we will round up due to the amazing service!  We came here last night to celebrate my 30th Birthday as it has been on my list to try for years but I was waiting for a special occasion and this seemed like the perfect one.  I was debating between a few options and finally settled on coming here due to Bailey Z's detailed and helpful review as the tasting menu seemed like way too much food / overwhelming so it was nice to know about the other 4 and 5 course options they offered.  I opted for the "4 course" $198 menu with 2 apps, 1 main, 1 dessert while the bf opted for the "5 course" $250 menu with 2 apps, 2 mains, and 1 dessert. Both came with the amuse-bouche and "seductive sweets" aka the decadent unlimited dessert cart which was pretty much like an extra course.  I choose the pescetarian friendly seafood options: 1) Le King Crab and Le Homard cold appetizers 2) Le Homard du Maine main course ($35 supplement) 3) La Mangue (dessert)  The bf choose: 1) La Chataigne and L'Oeuf de Poule Miroir hot appetizers 2) Le black cod and Le Boeuf main courses 3) La parfum de iles dessert  Since it was my birthday, they gave us a special cake in addition to the above AND gave us a complimentary extra entree (the seabass) AND 2 non-alcoholic mocktail drinks! Not sure if that is typical, because of the birthday, or if they were just feeling extra generous that night but it was definitely appreciated!  All of the food was delicious, definitely high quality with great flavor and presentation. The one thing I wasn't a big fan of was the sauce for the lobster main entree but the manager inquired about our feedback after the main course so I had mentioned this and when the bill came, he actually took the supplenental charge off which was an extremely unexpected but much appreciated surprise. This attention to detail, exceptional service, and commitment to excellence is truly what sets a place like this apart and makes it worth every penny!  Our waters were never empty and we must have been offered (and accepted) a solid 3 or 4 rounds from the delicious and famous bread cart. They were just attentive enough without going overboard. To top it off, they sent us home with sound pound cake in a nice gift bag!  Definitely recommend trying this place for your next celebration or special occasion!

YLQX9UWjB4YjRYsE6jHNTg.text: Everything was perfect, from the presentation of all the courses to the service, I was pleasantly surprised. Most of those famous chefs' restaurants in Vegas aren't as good as the real thing, unlike Joel Robuchon.   We came here at nearly 10PM on a Saturday. Everyone decided to go with the first choice of their set menus: two appetizers; two mains; and a dessert. Before starting our meal, we were presented a bread cart, all the bread we picked out were brought to the back to be warmed up. They were all really good, especially with their special sea salt butter. The best appetizer of the night were the smoked salmon with caviar on top, and lobster ravioli with truffle on top. My favorite main was the ribeye, followed by the suckling pig prepared four ways. The desserts were so so.   Then a "carnival" dessert cart was brought out for the complimentary sweets, it was cute and pretty, good to look at. But by then I had no room for anymore food.  All the waiters were friendly and very professional. After living in LA for awhile I really have missed that kinda of professional service. Joel Robuchon is now my favorite western restaurant in Vegas.

JQsWtOP-t8Ha6eiYWFLGjA.text: Why 3 stars?  This is quite painful to write as the expectations were sky high for the trip.  The location, staff and atmosphere is without a doubt 5 stars.   My wife and I decided for a special occasion to go BIG before we went home. We picked the highest level tasting menu and were ready to be impressed.   Sadly that did not happen.   There were some dishes that stood out and earned the stars on the wall..then there were some that fell flat. For $400+ each, I did not expect a fall.  If you go, the pick your own is the best choice as you can be specific on what sounds good and hopefully they meet your expectation.   Sadly we will not be back as there are way to many great options in the area.

M9_aqUN2k53jWQz0rcQf-Q.text: A complete experience from the moment you walk in to the moment you leave!   With their amazing food and outstanding service, is one of our favorite places in Las Vegas!  I always enjoy pretty much any plate they put in front of me. From the beginning to the end!  If you have the time and the appetite, give their tasting menu a go, with their great wine pairing suggestions.  We are happy to visit every time we get a chance!

eLoG69lYjkURHtQvoKcJSg.text: Such a fantastic experience - from the bread cart to the mignonettes this has to be one of the best meals that I've ever had. It was clear that each dish was prepared with care and precision making each one more delicious than the next.   Service at the restaurant was impeccable; our waiter dropped everything at the sight of me pouring my own water making sure it was done for me!  Attention to detail and guest satisfaction are clearly a priority for them.   The restaurant was more than accommodating for the celebration of my boyfriend's birthday even bringing us a special dessert for the occasion!  I will be recommending Joel Robuchon to those going to Las Vegas and looking for a special touch while there.

XAkUAvhjQwGFatKiQznzjQ.text: Came here for my birthday in January.  The decor of the restaurant was beautiful and service was good.  The food wasn't so memorable so I forgot what I had for dinner.  The desserts was great but we were overloaded on sweets when they brought out this cartful of treats.  After the treats they brought out a cake!!  Too much sweets already that when they brought out a cake I was already having a sugar rush I couldn't eat it.  They gave me a pound cake as a gift to take home (this is their theme to get boyfriends/husbands to take their love ones for a birthday dinner).   Don't waste your money here and take her to the one in Paris if you want an amazing experience.  I had the best experience at his restaurant in Paris filled with elegance, art, and amazing cuisine.  I find that most good restaurants that opens in Vegas is mostly theme and not the same dining experience.

WN9WhQ2DccubYfkh0PYG6g.text: It was a fantastic dining experience. The food presentations were incredible. The butter and the olive oil with the bread are so good. Especially the butter, the butter was the best butter I have ever had. Highly recommended.

fqKsUnSpjgMOvzI6szjtCQ.text: I had a fantastic experience at Joel Robuchon. He is  famous for winning Michelin's Three Star (highest stars), Forbes Five Stars, and AAA Five Diamond. Those are quite the accomplishments....   The food was absolutely wonderful. We ordered the Degustation menu, which consisted of 17 courses.. everything tasted so good and it had so much variety of tastes and textures. It was amazing on every level. The food was also beautifully presented. It is definitely an experience for your senses.  The service is highest of the top class of all star servers. They were operating at exceptional heights. Answered every question and met every single expectation... they never disappoint.   Make sure to make your reservation ahead of time.... the list can take quite long. It's not often you get to dine at a 3 Star Michelin's restaurant... and if it is often for you, then keep living your best life!  This dinner is a perfect one-of-a-kind experience. The decor is absolutely stunning. The type of stuff that is perfect for the gram and to snap. It's such an amazing experience! Definitely not inexpensive, but it's hands down worth every single cent!

G7mJN73abaqt7DMPOpydqA.text: So this place is definitely more of an experience than it is filling. So eat beforehand lol. I am vegan and gluten free and I'm pretty sure everything i was given had this criteria. I actually do wish there could've been more food on the plate and more vegan and gluten free options because everything i had was really good. The bread was either vegan or gluten free, not both. And they have like 12 different kinds. The desert tray, i feel like could also have more vegan options. Some of the chocolate wasn't great. Although, the small vegan jelly desert thing was actually good. The atmosphere was amazing though and i felt like they wanted to make sure we were comfortable with our food and everything. So the 4 stars is just because i wanted more food and options because of my allergens. Hopefully they add more to their menu.
